publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3096 Alison McInnes: Elaine Stephen’s Walkodile - Keeping Children Safe—That the Parliament congratulates Elaine Stephen, a teacher at Buchanhaven School in Peterhead, who has been presented with the award for Entrepreneurial Spirit at the John Logie Baird Awards; commends her for her innovation, the Walkodile, which is a child-safety device designed to keep children together when on walking trips, and encourages more people to follow Mrs Stephen’s example and search for ways to keep our children safe when out and about. Supported by: Nanette Milne*, Mike Pringle*, Trish Godman*, Bob Doris*, Hugh O’Donnell*

S3M-3096 Alison McInnes: Elaine Stephen’s Walkodile - Keeping Children Safe—That the Parliament congratulates Elaine Stephen, a teacher at Buchanhaven School in Peterhead, who has been presented with the award for Entrepreneurial Spirit at the John Logie Baird Awards; commends her for her innovation, the Walkodile, which is a child-safety device designed to keep children together when on walking trips, and encourages more people to follow Mrs Stephen’s example and search for ways to keep our children safe when out and about. Supported by: Nanette Milne, Mike Pringle, Trish Godman, Bob Doris, Hugh O’Donnell, Gil Paterson*, Hugh Henry*, Aileen Campbell*, Jim Tolson*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3096 Elaine Stephen’s Walkodile - Keeping Children Safe (lodged on 11 December 2008) Nigel Don*
S3M-3096 Elaine Stephen’s Walkodile - Keeping Children Safe (lodged on 11 December 2008) Nigel Don*, Sandra White*
